activities: Sungard Availability Services LP is a provider of Availability Services, such as Managed Services, Recovery Services, Consulting Services and Business Continuity Software (“Services”).  Sungard Availability Services will provide privacy protection to personal information transmitted to Sungard Availability Services by its prospective and existing customers, vendors or partners, their agents, representatives and employees from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland in accordance with the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles as described herein. When Sungard Availability Services is a data controller: - Personal information collected online and offline in connection with Sungard Availability Services business activities, including information concerning current, prospective and former customers; vendors and channel partners. Sungard Availability Services collects, transfers, and uses this information for a range of business purposes, including direct and indirect sales and marketing activities, provisioning of Services and related support, and quality assurance to improve Services and Customer experience. When Sungard Availability Services is a data processor: - When providing Services to its Customers, Sungard Availability Services may process personal data owned and controlled by its Customers (“Services Data”). Sungard Availability Services processes that data at the direction of its Customers and in accordance with the terms of its agreements with its Customers. Customers are responsible for compliance with applicable data protection principles. Sungard Availability Services maintains a separate Services Data Privacy Policy in connection with its provision of Services to its Customers.
contactoff1: Sungard Availability Services LP Compliance - Legal Department
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Personal data collected from current, prospective and former customers, vendors and channel partners (On-Line, Off-Line, Manually Processed).
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
